meanings.definition: The quality or state of being finite.
meanings.sent1: The finiteness of the universe is a topic of great interest to scientists.
meanings.sent2: The concept of finiteness helps us understand the limitations of our knowledge.
meanings.sent3: When the magician's hat had a bottom, it challenged the finiteness of his tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her patience seemed to have a finiteness, like a well that could run dry.
meanings.sent5: The finiteness of time became clear as the hourglass emptied slowly.

meanings.definition: The condition of having limits or boundaries.
meanings.sent1: The finiteness of the playing field made the game more challenging.
meanings.sent2: We must accept the finiteness of our resources and plan accordingly.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curiosity about the finiteness of the room led to some amusing antics.
meanings.sent4: The finiteness of the budget forced us to get creative with our spending.
meanings.sent5: The finiteness of the marathon route loomed ahead, challenging the runners.
